items.text: Jobs boost as Amazon announces plan for new site
items.subtext: The so-called fulfilment centre will be built in Northampton and could take customer orders in 2026.

items.text: Union to hold ballot at Amazon warehouse
items.subtext: The GMB union says it could result in a UK union being recognised by Amazon for the first time.

metadata.caption: It could be the first time that a UK union is recognised by Amazon

items.text: Amazon Prime ads help tech giant drive profits
items.subtext: The tech giant did better than expected in many areas of its business.

metadata.altText: Person watching Prime Video on TV

items.text: Stowaway cat accidentally mailed in returned package
items.subtext: Galeana is back home in the US state of Utah and in good health after spending six days in a box.

items.text: Travis Kelce gets new job as TV game show host
items.subtext: The Kansas City Chiefs star and Taylor Swift's boyfriend will front the show for Amazon Prime Video.

metadata.altText: Dec 3, 2023; Green Bay, Wisconsin, USA; Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce looks on during warmups prior to the Green Bay Packers against the Green Bay Packers at Lambeau Field.

items.text: Amazon defends selling book linked to woman's death
items.subtext: A coroner says a book telling people how to take their own lives is "readily available" on the site.

items.text: Stars say Fallout TV show brought games to life
items.subtext: Two stars of Amazon's adaptation of the hit video game talk about recreating its apocalyptic world.

metadata.altText: A young woman with long black hair stands in an artificially lit, cylindrical corridor with various pipes supported by bright yellow struts along its length She's looking back over her shoulder with an impassive expression. She wears a close-fitting, dark blue leather jumpsuit with panelling down the arms.

items.text: Amazon cuts hundreds of jobs in cloud business
items.subtext: Amazon Web Services represents 14% of the firm's overall revenue but the firm is shifting strategies.

metadata.altText: Attendees walk through an expo hall at AWS re:Invent 2023, a conference hosted by Amazon Web Service in Las Vegas.

items.text: Amazon workers walk out on two-day strike
items.subtext: More than 200 union members prepare to walk out of the firm's fulfilment centre in Sutton Coldfield.

metadata.caption: Amazon workers are on strike on Wednesday and Thursday

items.text: MacKenzie Scott donates $640m to US non-profits
items.subtext: She has given $16.5bn in donations since divorcing Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 2019.

metadata.altText: Ms. Scott is one of the world’s wealthiest women.

items.text: How Temu is shaking up the world of online shopping
items.subtext: Despite controversy China's Temu is becoming a global online shopping force.

items.text: Sweet maker to drop Amazon over stock row
items.subtext: Maxons Sweets claim Amazon are delaying paying invoices over non-existent stock issues

items.text: Amazon workers announce fresh strikes
items.subtext: Workers announce further strike dates in Coventry and Sutton Coldfield in a dispute over pay.

metadata.caption: GMB union members will go on strike on four dates in March

items.text: European parliament revokes Amazon lobbyist passes
items.subtext: MEPs have accused the retailer of failing to cooperate with enquiries into its working practices.

items.text: Amazon founder Bezos completes $8.5bn share sale
items.subtext: The firm had previously said its founder would sell up to 50 million shares by the end of January 2025.

metadata.altText: Jeff Bezos and partner Lauren Sanchez at Milan Fashion Week.

items.text: Big tech vows action on 'deceptive' AI in elections
items.subtext: Twenty firms have signed an accord pledging to stop voters being deceived but critics say it lacks teeth.

metadata.altText: Graphic of a hand putting a voting slip into a ballot box

items.text: Amazon founder Bezos sells shares worth over $4bn
items.subtext: The multi-billionaire moved to Florida last year, which has no state tax on share sales above $250,000.

metadata.altText: Lauren Sánchez and Jeff Bezos arrive at the Dolce&Gabbana Party during the Milan Menswear Fall/Winter 2024-2025 on 13 January, 2024 in Milan, Italy.

items.text: Amazon staff walk out on 'Valentine's Day' strike
items.subtext: About 1,000 workers in Coventry start three days of strike action in a dispute over pay.

items.text: Ring doorbell customers angry at 43% price hike
items.subtext: Users have taken to message boards to complain about the increase, which they say is unjustified.

metadata.altText: A finger pushing the button on a ring doorbell

items.text: Amazon staff target Valentine's Day with strike
items.subtext: A walkout of more than 1,000 staff is set to take place at the Coventry site from 13 to 15 February.

items.text: Saltburn's use of dressing gown shocks firm owner
items.subtext: The garment by British Boxers features prominently in the film that has been snubbed by Oscars judges.

metadata.altText: A scene from the movie Saltburn
metadata.caption: British Boxers' dressing gown can be seen in the Amazon Prime hit Saltburn

items.text: Zuckerberg wins on Wall Street after Washington hit
items.subtext: Meta shares surge as it reports a jump in users, ad sales and profits, despite Washington concerns.

items.text: Amazon-iRobot deal scrapped after EU challenge
items.subtext: The maker of the Roomba vacuum maker announces job cuts as the planned takeover collapses.

items.text: Workers at new Amazon warehouse on strike over pay
items.subtext: About 60 GMB members joined the picket line at the Sutton Coldfield site on Thursday morning.

metadata.altText: GMB members on strike on Thursday
